meanings.definition: The horizontal structure supported by columns in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: The entablature rested gracefully on the sturdy columns.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple featured an intricate entablature above the pillars.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the entablature, thinking it was a branch.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge was the entablature that held up the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The entablature, like a bridge, connected the columns in perfect harmony.

meanings.definition: A decorative band above columns in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: The entablature was adorned with intricate carvings and designs.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the beautiful entablature above the grand entrance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the entablature was a crown on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the entablature like a canopy of joy.
meanings.sent5: The entablature, like a frame, highlighted the beauty of the columns.
